website_summaries.verdict: Great for times when you need large amounts of ice in a hurry. Plan on removing it from the machine and using it quickly.
pros: Makes up to 1.5 pounds of ice in 6-8 minutes
cons: Ice doesn't stay cold in the basket and melts, and if you put it in the freezer, it may form a solid block

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for everyday use. Fits in our counter and doesn't take up much room. A little larger than my coffee maker. In less than 30 min it made 4 rounds of ice, still going strong. I let the machine settle over night after washing it then filled it with water, like the directions stated. Makes very little noise except when dumping ice ( you hear that) then it has a slight hum you have to really listen out for.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth.M

customer_reviews.title: Screams randomly I attached a video
customer_reviews.text: It makes ice. It's super loud while doing it, randomly makes a grinding mechanical noise like it's out of water when it's not out of water. Does it just starting out, does it mid day, does it as it's dropping ice. Super annoying. I wish we'd bought a different brand because it's near constant now. Hate it.
customer_reviews.author: cdiesel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty excited for this!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this ice maker and couldn't wait to try it out. I was surprised at how quickly it started to make ice cubes. I selected the small ones first, and within ten minutes of plugging the machine in I had the first batch of ice cubes. The basket was full in less than an hour. This is perfect if you need a large batch of ice, quickly. You have to pour water into the machine, you can't hook it up to a water line. It's not very loud either. I've included a picture and a video of the machine working.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, never made ice and appears to be a refurbished item that was packaged as new.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. What kind rejects are on your QA team? What I received has to be a defect and a repackaged device; it was hastily retaped and wrapped to look new while it has blemishes and a bizarre piece of torn up yellow foam or whatever it is on the bottom of the device. This is not a complex device it is a mere dumb ice maker with one function, that is it. This is blatantly disrespectful to waste customers' time and send out a simple ice maker that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: ktrader

customer_reviews.title: All it made was frozen clumps!
customer_reviews.text: I had an ice maker from another company that I loved but it broke. I came to Amazon and ordered this ice maker in hopes that it would replace the broken one. I got it home and started using it and it immediately started having problems. It would make clumps of ice instead of individual ice cubes. I tried everything the directions said to do and it would not make but maybe a quarter of a cup of ice a day. Definitely not a good machine and not worth the money! Order another brand or go somewhere else!
customer_reviews.author: BGail

customer_reviews.title: Nice little countertop ice maker!
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine that makes ice pretty quickly! I usually add filtered water for best tasting ice and use the large ice setting. The added bonus is that my cat is obsessed with this thing... he comes running when the ice cycles through and drops out of the maker. Little weirdo! The only problem is that he sometimes turns the machine off with his little paws and the ice will all melt if I don't notice soon enough... thankfully, like I said earlier the machine makes ice quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Crowell

customer_reviews.title: Good Ice Maker
customer_reviews.text: This review is a long term use review. We have owned this nearly two years now and we have enjoyed it greatly. It does make the first batch of ice in 9 or ten minutes but that first batch is really thin sad looking ice. Barely suitable to cool down a 10oz drink. After that and the interior cools down, it routinely makes ice every 9 minutes or so appropriate for one 10 to 12 oz drink unless you want a full cup of ice and you can have that about every 20 minutes. We use ours at least 5 times a week and it runs constantly on the weekends. I would not hesitate to recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: jessica l

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this ice maker!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ice maker. While it's not super speedy, seriously, it makes enough ice when you're cleaning your kitchen or around the area you're working in. Those who complained about it being wet, well the ice has to come off the pins and the water breaks that seal. I simply shake the basket, dump the ice in a gallon size ziplock, and throw it into the freezer. Every time I empty the bin into the baggie, I whack the bag on the counter to break the ice up, and voila, no ice chunks. This works like a charm. Lots of ice for my family get togethers! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: ...not for us...
customer_reviews.text: Completely underwhelming. After two hours of operation, the unit filled a third of the pan with small (even tho it was set on 'large'), wet bullet shaped ice that were rapidly melting. The collection pan is also very small. In our kitchen, the fan and compressor was also quite loud. Clearly not a defective unit -- just not what we were expecting and hoping for. Carefully repackaged and returned.
customer_reviews.author: StephLadder

customer_reviews.title: Company stands by its product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my ice maker just over a year ago. We loved it! It reliably made ice, and the ice was slow to melt in the tray. Then suddenly the ice maker just stopped working. We called the manufacturer to find out what was wrong with it. The representative talked us through a reset/check which did not work. Then the representative immediately offered to send us a replacement machine. The new machine arrived days later and works well. We are extremely pleased that the company stands by its products and offered to replace our beloved ice maker when it died!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not as hoped
customer_reviews.text: i was SO EXCITED to get this ice maker! i love ice so much. unfortunately, there is no way to clean it really well, which is why i ended up returning it. my ultra hard water would clog it up very quickly, and i was worried about mold/pink slime growing where i couldn't see it or clean it. plus, the ice had a weird taste when it melted. can't quite place what it was, but it was unpleasant.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Keep on shopping.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: This thing is a piece of trash. It completely stopped working after it started making all kinds of weird loud noises. The coils just stopped getting cold. Why isn't there a a no star option. I’ve had it for 6 months now and it’s getting worse by the day. It no longer senses that the water is low or out so the light doesn’t alert you. It also makes a loud grinding noise when refilling with water. I was very happy with it at first but after these months I have a feeling it’ll die sooner than later.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: although it's a cool concept, it was a NO GO for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to supplement my refrigerator ice maker. I figured I could use it during parties and also take it on vacation and keep my coolers topped off, but this thing takes A LONG time to get ice. It takes about 2 hours to fill, which isn't even enough to fill my blender. So, although it's a cool concept, it was a NO GO for me.
customer_reviews.author: R Porter

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: For two years, I enjoyed this ice maker. It was loud and the ice had to be pushed down because it stacked up in front of the sensors. The ice was good, but it had to be cleaned regularly because mold built up easily. I started using distilled water in it which helped. I gave it only one star because we have had it barely more than two tears and it is dead, registering that there is no water, but the reservoir is full.
customer_reviews.author: LCoop

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I moved to a place that has a refrigerator with no ice maker, so I thought this would help. It does make ice, but it’s not cold enough. The ice melts VERY fast in whatever drink I have. I finally started taking out the ice and putting it in my freezer. Then I have to break up the ice from the freezer (because it sticks together) Dissapointed
customer_reviews.author: Jean Mckelvey

customer_reviews.title: Inefficient; attractive unit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this ice maker to take on the road in our travel trailer so we could conveniently have refreshing cold drinks. Tried it out at home first. Nice looking unit but took all day to fill one gallon plastic ziplock baggie with ice. It is not worth the cost or the added weight in the trailer for the amount of time it takes to make the small quantity it makes. It has already been shipped back.
customer_reviews.author: servicepuppyraiser

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Entertaining
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my new fridge doesn't have a built-in ice maker. We just don't have the space to keep bags of ice in the freezer. PLUS, I don't like the hassle of ice cube trays. This is fantastic. TIPS: • Start the ice maker at least an hour before having guests over. • I love the "small" size option but you can choose medium or large too. • Keep the door closed for faster freezing. • Easy to transport if you want to bring your ice maker along to a party!
customer_reviews.author: Elsa Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Grows mold
customer_reviews.text: Biggest issue is that it doesn’t stay cold enough and mold has started growing inside in places that can’t be cleaned. I’ve never stayed solid. It was always a bit melted. I would advise pay more and get something that will really work.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Kate

customer_reviews.title: Died at 10 months.
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked fine for 10 months but now has stopped freezing the ice. It still goes through the motions but simply never freezes the water. I'm assuming that the Freon has been lost and I am unable to replace it in my current location so this will simply be thrown in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Schoenrock

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this icemaker for my office. It's slender footprint makes it ideal for a small kitchen space. Easy to use, you pour the water into the bottom compartment, touch the size ice cube you'd like to make, Close the top and you are all set. The box says it will make up to 26 pounds of ice per day, although I'm not sure we will go through that much... However the perfectly formed ice is not too hard or too soft and is made quickly. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Roni J

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: Our large extended family has quite a few get-togethers. This product makes ice extremely quickly. We've gotten a lot of use out of it. We run it several times the day prior to a get-together and put the ice in large plastic bags and store it in the deep freezer. It's more convenient to use the ice maker than to run down to the local drug store or gas station to buy a large bag of ice that usually ends up having an off flavor due to it being in storage for so long.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Wise

customer_reviews.title: good ice maker..so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought two ice makers one for mom and me in my RV. So far there working out good, its been about a month. When you first turn on the ice maker it takes about half hour the get big cubes. living in the southwest were its like 105 in the shade, this guy needs his ice. The vent fan on the side of the unit needs to be free to vent hot air and the something on the back of the unit, were fresh air is drawn in. so leave enough space around it. A red light well come on when the tray is full and low on water. nothing to it..
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: "Need Water" kiss of death
customer_reviews.text: Working great for about 7 days. Now the 'needs water' light is on. Turning it off and on will have it start the make cycle, but it sounds like the water pump isnt even trying to work. Has enough water, the pump just will not turn on. Returning for a replacement, lets see how round two goes!
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ice maker June 2018 and I have used it at least once weekly over the last 11 months and I LOVE IT. I bought it because we are living in an RV full-time and this has been one of the best investments I have made! The only advice I would give is once you have finished making ice.....DO NOT LEAVE ICE MAKER MOIST. PAT DRY WITH PAPER TOWELS AND THEN AIR DRY WITH THE LID OPEN UNTIL COMPLETELY DRY. If you leave any moisture, you will grow mold! I make ice and pack it into quart size bags and store in freezer. A light tap will break ice apart when you are ready to use. Simple!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great countertop icemaker, and fabulous customer support!
customer_reviews.text: hOmeLabs has outstanding customer service, and can't say enough about that. My machine came as ordered, but had some problems with it which were sort of solved, but didn't stay solved. Pretty sure I got a lemon, which I know can happen. I emailed them and had a response within an hour the first time. They sent a replacement for it which is working fine, and I really love it. I would order again, and will surely investigate their other products. It speaks volumes when a company is so easy to contact, AND helpful.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mcclain

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: We bought this ice machine back in 2018 we have used it every day since and we brought it camping with us in our RV. It has been awesome having ice all the time! Update: I highly recommend this ice machine as reviews this everyday and all the sudden it stopped working I called customer service and they sent us through some troubleshooting steps it worked at first and then it stopped working and because it was still under warranty no-questions-asked they sent us a new unit!! I was already very happy with this ice machine but their customer service just put this over the top thank you for standing behind your product with little to no hassle!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Reliable AF, Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so we've had this icemaker for over a year now and we ABSOLUTELY. LOVE IT! We use it to make bags of ice to take fishing so I leave it running all day and empty the basket when it's full, refill with water when it's needed. And the little sucker just RUNS...The fan isn't silent, but it's not especially loud either. It's only noisy when it dumps a batch of ice into the bucket. Yes, the ice tends to be wet but we don't care. It doesn't make any noise when it's too full to run or runs out of water. This icemaker is worth every penny we spent on it. Buy this one...
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Ice ice baby
customer_reviews.text: For those of you who don’t have an ice maker in their fridge or are excessive ice consumers, this is the gadget for you. This thing pumps out ice all day and reliably. We have used t pretty much every day since we bought it and it’s great. It takes a while to get used to the sound of the fresh ice being dropped into the bucket but otherwise it’s quiet. I wish it had a little beeper to let you know when the basket is full because I tend to forget to dump it and I end up wasting my ice. Or some of t at least.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine!
customer_reviews.text: This ice maker makes ice quickly and is quiet. The bullet shaped cubes are wet to the touch so I dump them onto a clean towel to blot them off before putting them in the freezer. It's easy to fill a gallon size zip bag within a few hours. It will stop when the basket is filled. Twice, so far, it has flashed full when it wasn't but all I needed to do was remove the little bin and replace it. Very happy with the performance so far. I've only owned it for a couple months and I don't use it every day. I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: The Ice melts while still in the machine
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for several days... And there are several issues. The ice didn't stay cold enough and begins to melt. Also if a piece gets stuck near the top of the ice tray ( has happened frequently) the machine stops as it thinks the tray is full when it is not. As this is my first purchase of a countertop ice machine I don't know how to compare to other brands but I'm disappointed... I really was hoping to write a more optimistic review. I do like the ice size and shape.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie McClain

customer_reviews.title: So Sad, my heart may actually break!
customer_reviews.text: 1st, I want everyone to know that this ice machine became my most valuable appliance! Seriously. Especially during hard stay-at-home times, and of course hot summers, lazy weekends and stress filled days. I purchased this ice machine a year ago (June 9, 2019). I didn't buy the one my boss purchased because this one was superior! It is with a very sad heart that I must let you know, it is now leaking all over the counter. I have treasured this machine and taken good care of it. If anyone knows what the problem may be, please let me know, otherwise it will have to be thrown out I am afraid...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The little ice machine that could
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Don't listen to the people that try to make ice with this in 100 degree sun. It just keeps chugging along. We start making ice (indoors of course) (No this is not a refrigerator!!!) about 2 hours before we have company (bought the ice bags recommended by Amazon) and by the time friends show up we have all the ice we need (I gad bag it and put it in the freezer) and if we go long I just keep it going and it just keeps up. I found if you put the first batch or two in the reservoir it speeds up the process cause the water is already cold. You will not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: WorkingDeuce

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Updated review 8/18/2020: about a 1 1/2 later I had to use the warranty as the unit stopped working. I received the replacement in March 2019. Everything fine till a few weeks ago. The unit stopped making ice and making weird noises. Since this unit was only a little over a year old I thought the warranty would be valid. After numerous emails and videos/ pictures of what was happening...they refused to replace. So 2 units in less than 2.5 years broken! Don’t waste your money on this ice machine!!!!! ************************************************** Bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes ice fast, pain to use long term
customer_reviews.text: Our refrigerator water line is on the fritz, so our water and ice tasted awful. Purchased this maker as an alternative to bagged ice from gas station. It does the job quickly and quietly. The problem is, the machine doesn't store the ice, so you're constantly dumping. And mold appears shortly after you stop using. Cleaning is a challenge because the interior parts are small and oddly shaped. I never felt like we could get it clean. My sister had a machine that stores the ice and mold is not a problem. It's quite a bit more expensive but, having tried the cheap route, I now realize it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer/distributor has agreed to a refund.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sending the unit off for a refund. I'm disappointed that the ice maker failed. I changed my rating because the manufacturer/distributor agreed to a refund. Well, for now I have to retract my ringing endorsement. We had the unit for 100 days and it stopped working. Amazon has sent an email to the manufacturer/distributor. I'll update you when the issue is resolved. Right now I'd say buy ice. Ignore the following. As advertised. Makes ice quickly, quietly. We use distilled water for flavor and to avoid mineral build up. We have it in our travel trailer. It'll pay for itself in one season as opposed to going to town to buy ice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for chewing ice, but I don't know how long-lasting it is
customer_reviews.text: I had this ice maker for about a year, year and a half. I loved the ice--perfect for chewing. My biggest issue, however, was that it was difficult to keep clean. I don't know if it was just my water, but a film would develop inside the machine relatively quickly. And eventually, if I waited to long, there were some parts I could not get completely clean. I did use it VERY heavily (running almost all day every day), but it seems it began malfunctioning towards the end of its life, and I got rid of it after getting a fridge with an ice maker.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Ice maker...
customer_reviews.text: We dont have a lot of freezer space & I like to have ice around during the summer & family gatherings. Does it produce ice in 8-13 minutes? Yes, but only like 8 ice cubes at a time. The basket isn't very large so whenever it would get filled, I'd put it in a container in the freezer. It's not as cold as freezer made ice so be prepared that if put in the freezer for later use, they will stick together & you'll need to break them apart. Not a big deal, just be aware so you use the right container.
customer_reviews.author: RoseRed

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, fast, short-lived, clunky design
customer_reviews.text: Stops making ice even when the tray is not full - others discussed that issue. It's also noisy as all get out. It's easy to use. It lasted a year almost to the day with heavy use. It just gave up, like it was tired of making ice and disappointed in it's inability to do its job quietly. Walked off the job after only a year! No call, no nothing. Total A-hole.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great portable ice maker
customer_reviews.text: If you're camping and have access to electric (or a portable generator), this thing is great. It makes ice really fast. Now it's not clear/rock solid ice; it's milky so it's soft (has air in it). But it keeps you from having to run to the store to get bags of ice for your drinks. And if you run it long enough, you can add ice to your cooler. If you do a lot of RV camping - get one. If you have an area at home without a freezer and need ice for cold drinks - get one. It does cost a bit and it's not an "essential" item; but for us, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Great ice maker
customer_reviews.text: Though a bit pricey, this is one nice little ice maker. Easy to operate, and it does make perfectly sized cubes to keep our drinks cold. Very little noise other than when the fresh cubes drop into the bin. Very little heat generated by the fan too. Takes up only a small space on the counter. The first cubes will look a bit wet but once the water in reservoir gets properly chilled the cubes will last long enough that we can transfer them to our freezer, or leave in the bin in the machine. We can also use it poolside
customer_reviews.author: Ken Tanguis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome addition to the home.
customer_reviews.text: The ice maker has been a great addition to our home. We were always running out of ice from our refrigerator, we’d always fill the kids hydroflasks and our owns. So we tried purchasing bagged ice, but that was always a pain. I found this on amazon and it had great reviews and I can see why.
customer_reviews.author: Ann De la cruz

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy ice maker.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a powerhouse. We have it running all day long, every day. We use a lot of ice, and this maker keeps up with our needs. When we had two icemakers in our refrigerator die, back to back, I started using ice trays. After way too many fights about who put the empty ice tray back in the freezer, I ordered this ice maker. I love how quickly it makes ice. I still keep our ice in the tray that came in our freezer, and I have to break it up after a few loadings because the ice comes out pretty wet and sticks together, but it’s so much better than ice trays.
customer_reviews.author: crys*d

customer_reviews.title: Makes a lot of ice quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ice maker because I don't have enough room in my refrigerator freezer for bags of ice. After I ordered the item, it came quickly and I set it up on my kitchen counter. The unit fits under the upper cabinet, but the upper lid will not open 100%. You don't need the lid to open all the way as you can access filling the reservoir with water and removing the ice without it being fully up. I notice no funny taste and I 'm using good ol' water from the taps of California. It puts out approx. 10 bullet shaped cubes in about 8 min. The reservoir holds a lot of water. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia l. dalrymple

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a failed Igloo (lasted 1.5 years) with this one to try it out. It's dull silver finish is not as attractive as the Igloo and it's much noisier - both when it drops ice and during fan/compressor operation. Had to add a make-shift sound barrier to reduce fan/compressor noise. Seemed to have problems in small ice cube mode so switched to large and works fine there - except a little slow.
customer_reviews.author: Lastamba

customer_reviews.title: Worked flawlessly for 2 years now!
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I purchased this item in June of 2018. It’s now April of 2020. I waited 2 years to write a review because I was worried about longevity. Well let me tell you. This thing has supplied ice for our household FLAWLESSLY for almost 2 years now. Zero issues. The ice is made fast and tastes great. (I do use bottled water in it). I couldn’t be happier with this purchase. If it broke tomorrow I would buy another in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S. Housley

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect to use it forever.
customer_reviews.text: While it worked, it was satisfactory. Nothing crazy great, but definitely did the job. It fills up fast, and then you have to keep an eye on water level as well as emptying the ice regularly as it doesn't keep it cold. But, it was easy to use. After 2 years it doesn't work anymore. I only used it lightly for a few months, then it was stored away. I only just now brought it back out. I'm pretty miffed, since it's quite expensive to only work for a short amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Bean

customer_reviews.title: Great when you need fast ice.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I was tired of making ice everyday.. Now that I have had it a number of months, it is good for making ice when you are in a bind, but it is not refrigerated so the ice is wet and has to be placed in a plastic freezer bag after three or four loads and laid flat in the freezer or you have to hammer it apart. The cubes are small and barrel shaped. I use the big cube selection, but they still are small. Great machine if your freezer goes out. I will also mention it does take up counter space and is heavy.
customer_reviews.author: km in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product and customer service. I purchased this item in August 2018. It has worked perfectly to produce fresh ice for our family on a daily basis. We placed it on our counter and it has encouraged us to drink more water. We had a problem with the unit in October 2019. My husband emailed the company on a Saturday, thinking we would get a reply on Monday. We were pleasantly surprised when the company emailed back several hours later and sent us out a replacement. I highly recommend this product, because of both the way the product performs and because the company stands behind its product.
customer_reviews.author: Jane M. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: My roommate exclaimed from the kitchen "Aww the little ice cubes are so cute!". We use ALOT of ice and the trays are just a pain to use. (plus we've already broken 3 in the course of 5 months) This thing is amazing. It doesn't take long at all to make a little basket full of the cubes. You have the option of different sizes of ice. The machine does smell when you first get it out of the box but it says to let it set for 24 hours before use. We did that and the machine doesn't smell now and the ice flavor was not affected at all.
customer_reviews.author: Naeann

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: OK this is a bit big for everyday countertop use, so it doesn't stay there all the time, but as I have been weaning off diet sodas I am using a lot of ice, and my freezer is full. This is doing exactly what it says - it makes ice quickly and efficiently. It's fun to watch for the first few times too. I make ice in batches and stuff the bags in spare holes in the freezer. The ice is fresh and tastes just like the water it came from. I use it every 2-3 days and am finding it very useful and easier than upgrading the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: MADianne

customer_reviews.title: have to dry off the cubes
customer_reviews.text: well it's a fun device, with major problems. Have to have a system cause ice cubes come out quite wet and stick together if you just transfer to freezer. So after experimenting, this works best: Let it work till it's full. then dumb them onto a towel, fold up, shake, so water is dried off, then transfer to freezer. wipe remaining water off basket etc. with paper towel.
customer_reviews.author: Renee E. DesRosiers

customer_reviews.title: It never made a cube of ice.
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked it this weekend. Want to make some ice at our small cabin on our farm. I fill it with drinking water and waited for the ice to start forming but it never happened. It ran for 40 minutes. I then felt the freezing rods and they were warm. Unfortunately for me I missed my return window which ended on the 4th of this month. Not sure what other options I have. This really sucks after all the good reviews and then I end up with a faulty device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'd give it 10 stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: I bought my machine last spring and have had it running 24-7 ever since (it is now late February). I live in Southern California and have no air conditioner, so massive amounts of ice were consumed over the summer, and I still enjoy iced drinks in the winter. The machine easily keeps up with demand. I have literally run the machine all day and night for as long as I've had it, just adding water when the add water light comes on. It's a little champ, very quiet, and very reliable. I do used filtered water to keep deposits from building up in the lines. So pleased with this item!
customer_reviews.author: crabby old bat

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking...there's better ice machines for the same price.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a couple different ice machines before and this is the one I like the least. The basket is small and takes up a lot of room, which means you constantly have to keep emptying the ice basket. I've seen others that the water goes in the back and the entire front holds the ice, which is what I should have got. This ice machine seems louder and louder every day. We've tried our best to clean this thing, which is near impossible. The ice tastes horrible no matter how many times we clean it. I would not reccomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: KELLI LAMB

customer_reviews.title: Makes Ice Quickly But Gets Slushy and Can Be a Bit Noisy When Making Ice
customer_reviews.text: Meets all of my needs, but somewhat different than what I was expecting... Pros: 1. Takes up much less space than a typical floor model ice machine for an office setting (and a lot less expensive) 2. Makes ice much faster than a traditional freezer 3. Quiet when not making ice Cons: Unlike a stand-alone floor model or automatic ice machine in a freezer... 1. The noise when it dispenses the ice and fills the water tray can be a bit distracting if you're sitting near it 2. If your not taking out ice on a regular basis, it gets slushy 3. Someone needs to keep manually filling it with water
customer_reviews.author: jelarv

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Our refrigerator broke, and our ice maker wouldn't work. We bought this and couldn't be happier. It makes little ice bullets. It's relatively fast upon turning it on. If you don't use the ice, it melts and goes back into the reservoir. I am very very pleased with this product and strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Peydirt18

customer_reviews.title: I am enjoying this ice maker!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ice maker so I can have some ice outside of the refrigerator during the summer. Meanwhile I ended up having to have surgery which required me to have ice packs to reduce swelling. This little machine fit the bill and was awesome even though I did not buy it for that reason. I never run out of ice and I am enjoying it. When the ice falls into the tray it can't stun you but that is expected. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: lulu

customer_reviews.title: It saved summer!
customer_reviews.text: The water hookup on my fridge got damaged in the door and I was out of ice! Bags went up to 2.50 during the summer and they take up room in the freezer. This machine is great. The ice is easy to store, more convenient than the bulky cubes you get from trays, and seems to make a new batch of 9 cubes every ~12-17 minutes (I haven't actually timed it. But it makes enough ice to get my family through the summer days!
customer_reviews.author: Janae

customer_reviews.title: Freeze together if you reFreeze
customer_reviews.text: Dumping the ice reservoir into our Freezer (even if I tilt the reservoir several directions to drain the water off the ice) seems to always refreeze as a block of cubes. We've also had noise issues when the supply reservoir gets low the pump grinds rather loudly. We also had noise issues with the blade that moves from the freezing compartment to the ice reservoir scraping with a plastic on plastic friction. Even with these imperfections, I WOULD PURCHASE AGAIN because of the great convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ice Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Ice Maker to replace a 5-year-old Igloo model that started to fail. This machine functions basically identically to the other machine, but this one seems a bit quieter (my main complaint on the Igloo was how noisy it was). I also like how this one has a larger viewing window and the controls are on near the back of the unit. On the Igloo model, the controls were on the lid and the buttons would sometimes get pressed when I opened or closed the lid. That is not a concern with this unit. all in all, this is a very nice machine for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works well for "party ice" but it is wet so you need to transfer to freezer
customer_reviews.text: It is great for me, because I use it to supplement my expensive Frigidaire's ice maker which blows. I can make a large tupperware container of ice in about 2 hours. I transfer the ice to the fridge every few cycles so it can freeze solid. It's a bit wet sitting in the basket, so it does tend to refreeze in chunks but it breaks apart again easily. The "too wet" issue is the reason for the missing star. It does the job, it's fairly quiet and I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: NB Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Ice Maker with Helpful Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Great price, great customer service, and quality product. I've had this ice maker for more than a year and a half without failing and constant daily use... just until recently. It still made ice, but sometimes in big chunks and water sensor stopped working (would still make ice but with low water level). Anyway, I contacted customer support to warranty the ice maker, and they quickly sent a replacement. Can't ask for anyone more or anything better than this.
customer_reviews.author: jenjennjennnn

customer_reviews.title: Combats global warming
customer_reviews.text: I'm not running a water line underneath my outdated kitchen floor to have ice in our fridge. I use that empty void for chicken nugget storage now, anyways. This counter top ice maker takes up some valuable counter space, but it's a life changer. Regular tea transforms into Iced-Tea. Regular water becomes Iced-Water. The ice it produces, in a ridiculously short amount of time, cures boo-boos when put into zip-lock bags, makes warm beer into cold beer, and is great for a zero calorie dog treat when you realize you forgot to get dog treats for the third week in a row.
customer_reviews.author: Student Loan Budget Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Kicks out ice fast
customer_reviews.text: Yes all ice makers have "watery" ice. This unit tho kicks out small and large cubes with holes very fast. It's made ice now for almost a month straight and no issues. Wish you could hook up a water line to it and the holding chamber was bigger but then cubes would melt while they sat there I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: TRGau

customer_reviews.title: How did we live without this?
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted an ice maker for a long time, but thought my only option was having one in our freezer. That wasn't really going to work, because we would have had to totally redo the plumbing in the kitchen. We got an ice maker at my office and I was amazed and sold. I almost immediately ordered one for home. It's inexpensive. It's easy to use. It makes ice really fast. It is a bit noisy, but I think it's worth it. Our five year old granddaughter runs to the kitchen when she hears the ice dropping. She loves to watch the process.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Hildebrand

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT FOR THE PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: When our ice maker went out in our fridge, we were so bummed because we live in hot and sunny Arizona where adequate amounts of ice is necessary to keep our water bottles and adult beverages cold! We researched the best counter-top ice makers and this one stuck out. We are so glad that we made this purchase! It makes ice quickly and doesn't take up too much room on our kitchen counter. We also bought some large ice bags so that we can make our own ice for camping, the lake, or long car trips. We LOVE this machine and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Mahaffey

customer_reviews.title: Makes ice quickly but if your looking for a space saver this is not great on that
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in yesterday and already filled up my ice tray in the freezer. My freezer has a automatic ice maker that went out and rather then paying for a new one I got this for the house and RV. Makes ice quickly but if your looking for a space saver this is not great on that. Its probably about the size of a double toaster. You have to leave about 4 inch clearance all the way around it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, sub-standard product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in 2017. It ran well for seven months. The refrigeration compressor failed. I contacted the manufacturer and they sent me a replacement. The new unit failed after five months due to an inoperative water pump. Clearly this product fails from a quality standpoint. I would advise that this product not be purchased, quality and reliability are severely lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. McNally

customer_reviews.title: It's now a paperweight.
customer_reviews.text: After only nine months, this ice machine only makes a handful of ice in over an hour. Definitely will not be purchasing another of this brand. Got to go, need to run down and purchase some ice.
customer_reviews.author: UOdux

customer_reviews.title: Requires more interaction than expected, but happy with production overall
customer_reviews.text: Served us well for Summer, supplementing sporadic built in ice-maker production. Small ice cubes melt quickly, worked better if I put a frozen stick o butter in the collection basket. Used cubes directly, or put them in a shallow layer in freezer - wet enough they needed to re-freeze while the next basket was being made, then I would break up and toss into built-in’s hopper for the door dispenser. Seems a lot of work, but got into a rhythm doing this every other day; enough to keep 6 people happy with ice on hot days.
customer_reviews.author: JoanneR

customer_reviews.title: Performs as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: It's quite fast, motor is quiet. Of course the cubes are wet enough so that they stick together in the freezer, but I didn't pay for the storage basket to be refrigerated. I take a tub out of the freezer, put a kitchen towel over them and slam the cubes with a meat tenderizer hammer. It's been 2 months without a problem. I bought the extended service plan because the indwelling ice makers have failed in every fridge I've had. I am full-time on my RV and those fridges suck. I bought the unit because I am tired of dragging ice bags around.
customer_reviews.author: Judi M.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT,
customer_reviews.text: love it, love it. So easy to use, a steady supply of ice. Does not freeze ice solid, which makes it perfect for ice chewers(me). I buy a bag of ice almost every other day so this has already been a big convenience and should pay for itself in a short time. Runs very quietly, the only sound I hear is when the ice drops into the tray. Takes up a bit of counter space but frees up freezer space, which I need more than counter space. Recommended for any ice lover.
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: Worked pretty well for 10 months
customer_reviews.text: A little noisy, and would benefit greatly from a drain (for the old water, versus the “pick it up and balance it upside down over the kitchen sink” method currently in play). Inconveniences aside, the remarkably short lifecycle of my unit far outweighs the convenience of fresh ice while we entertain (easier, more reliable, and cost effective to just buy bags of ice ahead of time (seems this ice cost me $10/month by the time it died).
customer_reviews.author: KodiakFisherman

customer_reviews.title: This Ice Maker works exactly as described without a flaw
customer_reviews.text: After researching and reading the reviews of several different ice makers I decided to purchase this hOmeLabs Portable Ice Maker Machine. After receiving the unit I plugged it in, added water, chose the size of the ice that I wanted and turned it on. This ice maker has been producing ice withour any issues. This ice making macine works great and exactly as advertised. I highly recommend this hOmeLabs Portable Ice Maker Machine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Ice Fast!
customer_reviews.text: The ice in my office tastes horrible due to the various leftovers placed in our office fridge. I bought this machine to provide me with fresh tasting ice. It begins making ice within about 6 minutes. After about an hour, you have a nice supply of ice. I make the ice in the morning, then place it in a freezer ziploc bag for use throughout the day. I'm very pleased with this purchase. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Horton

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 60 days of light use
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this ice maker when I bought it. Granted it has some drawbacks but I was satisfied overall. However, i have now had it for 2 months and it has starter making a terrible noise. I think the pump that draws water from reservoir is going out. The return window was only 30 days amd I have now owned it 60 days. Not sure how to resolve this. I have attempted to contact customer support from Amazon but every time I try to enter my phone number it tells me I don't have enough numbers. I have tried multiple times and am now frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: Kelley, RN

customer_reviews.title: Great ice maker with an expiration date
customer_reviews.text: When we were searching for counter-top ice makers, we read a review of this one that said it was great, until it wasn't. Most reviews said it lasts between 18 months and 2 years. Well, they were right. That's exactly what happened. So we went into it with the knowledge that we would buy another one roughly 2 years down the line. The affordability and the quality of the ice cubes themselves, make this an acceptable option for us. We love the ice, it's not terribly loud and it doesn't give off a lot of heat.
customer_reviews.author: Sherilyn Powell-Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Felt like ice maker should have come a little cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Felt like ice maker should have come a little cleaner. It had a few scuff and dirty spots on the inside upon arrival. It isn't too difficult to clean though so I decided to keep. Had to run it 5-6 times before filter started coming back clean enough to eat the ice (I only use bottled water. ) Positives are that the machine makes ice very quickly and dispenses a good load amount every time. Ice also last a good amount of time in machine without melting which is a very big plus. Overall, Glad I purchased this ice maker. It'll work well for everyday and special event use.
customer_reviews.author: Nnahh

customer_reviews.title: Makes cubes fast.
customer_reviews.text: The colder the water in the tank gets the bigger the cubes get. I started to dump the first run cubes back in the tank and go from there. makes a nice size cube and works well in drinks. I wouldn't try to fill a cooler though. empty the bin in a zip lock bag and put them in to the freezer to harden them up.
customer_reviews.author: Brian F

customer_reviews.title: Ice punch bar rusted
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd portable ice machine, we purchased it for home use in June 2018. We have used the machine maybe a dozen times, inside, each time cleaning and drying it completely. When cleaning it to get it ready for summer use, i noticed the bars that "punch" holes in the ice are rusted- the rust will not come off. Important to note our first ice machine which we keep at camp, is now five years old, used outdoors and not a spec of rust.
customer_reviews.author: Dorrie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ice texture
customer_reviews.text: I’m obsessed with chewing ice. So of course I looked into the igloo ice machine but after reading reviews I decided on the hOmelabs machine because of the texture of the ice. It’s not hard, but has a softness to it. Some people say damp. Either way it’s perfect for chewing. This machine makes a new batch every 9 minutes or so. Obviously I’m full on ice due to the quick turn around. Set up was easy. Haven’t cleaned it yet, but the other reviews say it’s not too difficult. So far VERY happy
customer_reviews.author: TRagland

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ice maker to have if you intend to just use for drinks here and there. It does produce a lot ice within a day but you have to empty it about every 15-20 minutes ALL day to reach the total amount of ice it can produce in 24 hours. It has a small ice basket inside (hence frequently emptying) Once its full it automatically stops producing ice so it doesn't overflow but my main complaint is if you dont get it emptied shortly after the ice will start to melt back into the water supply, so just a fore warning. Nice size ice that fits in most cups and bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but understand limitations and size
customer_reviews.text: Had for almost 2 months. Pretty nice. It starts making ice within minutes. Do be prepared for the counter-space it takes (note measurements), and it makes small batches at a time, but pretty quick between batches. You need to get the batches into the freezer before they start to thaw in the dispenser bin (I would say the bin is insulated, but not chilled), and they do tend to stick together once frozen in freezer, but easy to split apart. I can't imagine using this for a gathering real time, I would make batches of ice ahead and freeze, for future use. Makes nice little almost conical shaped cubes with a hole in the center (approx 1 inch long).
customer_reviews.author: JLP

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this because I recently had a left total ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I recently had a left total knee replacement and I purchased an ice machine to help in the recovery process. My fridge just couldn't keep up with the amount of ice required for the ice machine to work properly. I purchased this to help with that problem. The machine makes ice quickly and a batch fits in the ice machine. They ice cubes tend to last longer if I put them in the freezer for a couple of hours but other than that, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Austen Fan from VA

customer_reviews.title: Works Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this ice maker nonstop daily since we purchased it 14 months ago, and it has worked flawlessly, our ice maker failed in our refrigerator out of warranty so we are using this portable ice machine instead “UPDATE” after 17 months of continuous use it finally died, however a call to their customer service center and the person I spoke with was very helpful to resolve the situation, and they are replacing the defective unit no charge because of their 2 year warranty on the ice maker, can’t go wrong purchasing a product that a company stands behind, 5 plus stars
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing! We’ve had it less than a year and all of the sudden it’s making tiny ice cubes. I’ve cleaned it, reset it and it’s still doing it. For the money I’d expect it to last at least a full year.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Very misleading description - does not "store" ANY ice as the storage tray is not cold enough...
customer_reviews.text: Makes ice in 8 minutes... but only 9 pieces at a time. The small tray fills and it stops, while the tiny amount of ice in the tray slowly melts. Trying to find usability but will likely return before the 30-day window expires. Also the vendor sent me a second unit by mistake... keeps asking me to return it (which I will happily do, with a return label) but fails to issue a return label. Multiple emails back and forth... what a waste of time!
customer_reviews.author: AlanS

customer_reviews.title: The manufacturer told it as it is!
customer_reviews.text: The ice maker did exactly what the directions said it would do. I use it for cocktails and my dogs are ice crunchers. I have noticed that the bagged ice at the store is softer...henceforth, it melts in the drinks faster. I have only used it once, so hopefully it will perform well in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know how much I needed this until I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: For those of us renting or without fancy fridges that make ice you might think you can keep a stiff upper lip and trudge on through life without ice. You can buy it for parties otherwise who needs it, right? Well, YOU need it. I did not think I needed this until I set it up and turned it on. Here's why: 1. It takes up very little space compared to some ice makers I've seen. 2. It makes ice FAST. Much faster than I thought it would. 3. It is very easy to drain and thus keep in good order until next use. So far very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A.McClintock

customer_reviews.title: Makes great ice!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this machine for a year and it still works great. It obviously would not replace a refrigerator ice maker (does not store cold ice or crush it), but for small families it works just fine. It basically keeps the basket full of ice which is enough for most purposes. It would not work for a large party. It is fairly easy to clean. It is a little on the noisy side, but not bad. I like being able to add my own filtered water to ensure the ice is clean. It takes up the counter space similar to that of a Keurig coffee machine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Phipps

customer_reviews.title: Great ice maker - for home or RVing
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine! Have had it for 2 years and though we normally use it in our RV during our camping trips, we do use it at home occasionally too. Works quickly and efficiently. As far as taste, the ice tastes fine if you’re using water that tastes fine. Use lousy water and you’ll taste lousy ice. It doesn’t have its own filter so what you put in is what you get out. Some people complain in their reviews that the ice tastes bad but they probably don’t stop to think about why. Very happy with this product. Does what it’s advertised to do.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Our freezer's ice machine doesn't make enough for the whole family so this was a great purchase for that
customer_reviews.text: This little machine was a life saver this past week. We frequently go to Disney World for the day and take water packs. Our freezer's ice machine doesn't make enough for the whole family so this was a great purchase for that. Then along came Hurricane Irma. We immediately started making ice to stock the freezer and fridge in the event that we lost power. I'm so glad we did because we did indeed lose power and we were able to take all that extra ice and keep our perishables cold. The machine is quiet and so easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: unknown

customer_reviews.title: Its 1.5 inch too tall to fit under countertop cabinets, dificult scoop, ice doesnt keep frozen.
customer_reviews.text: Our countertop opening is 18.5 inches tall; and the icemaker is exactly 1 inch too tall to fit opening the lid. So, the next model should be 1.5 inches shorter height, to be practicaly usable space under a countertop. I drilled holes in the 4 corners of the tray to drain better, to prevent spiling when lifting an pouring. Scoop is unefective; and lifting the tray and pouring is not much beter a method.
customer_reviews.author: Nik Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Machine just died after 15 months!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine In May 2018. It just stopped working for no reason at all. I tried adding more water, unplugging it and plugging it back in again, but it's still broken. I don't see any kind of warranty with the machineAnd I guess I didn't buy one. This is the 2nd machine of this type that I have purchased for my office; the 1st lasted 2 years and this one only lasted 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: catherine1358

customer_reviews.title: more of a toy, think “easy bake oven” counterpart - not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This thing arrived smelling of plastic, with a lot of particulate in it, presumably from the manufacturing/assembly process. There’s no good or easy way to clean it, but after a thorough attempt, got it up and running. On the small setting, which is recommended in the manual, the teeny tiny ice cubes melt nearly immediately, and it ain’t fast at making them. Decided to return it, after 1 full cycle (which took ~ a day), and went to pull the drain plug - which broke off in the machine. Great timing?
customer_reviews.author: matt b

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product, it made ice very quickly, great for get togethers. It worked flawlessly until it just stopped working. The needs water lights stays on and it will not make ice. I've reached out to hOmeLabs to see if they will help. They sent me emails for 3 weeks promising a replacement, none every came. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS ITEM!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective item
customer_reviews.text: I like the convenience of this product however yesterday it began making a dreadful noise on each cycle. I purchased it on 06/12/18 I'm in hopes it will be resolved with the seller
customer_reviews.author: Dee Cofty

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and makes ice quickly
customer_reviews.text: I wish you could store the ice in it all the time and it made more cubes at once. However i just transfer it all to my freezer. We used to have an under the counter ice maker that was $3000 and we replaced the computer board and had a repair man out and even after spending $700 they needed another $1500 for a new compressor and to find the leak so we decided not to continue to invest nor relace. That under the counter one was only 3 yrs old so this was a much better option. We are pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn E. Keeley

customer_reviews.title: Everyday ice maker.
customer_reviews.text: This ice machine has been used almost everyday since the day I purchased it. Yes, it does not refrigerate the ice, but even in 100 degree Santa Ana winds weather, it still has frozen ice to enjoy. I try to do 2 full buckets a day, but it does take a while. I set and forget it, check on it in an hour or so. The bucket is usually full by this time. I use my brondell filtered water for this machine and have not had any issues with build up. My wife and I love it, we've ditched the ice cube trays!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lee

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: This is the third ice maker I have owned, 2 EDGESTAR ones and an IGLOO one. None of them last more then 1 year, often less. This one, hOmeLabs too only lasted one year and now it stopped working as well. I don't understand why these don't last. I just bought this same model for my daughter since mine made it just past a year, but now i am returning it since it doesn's last either.
customer_reviews.author: JMoney

product_meta.title: hOmeLabs Portable Ice Maker Machine for Countertop - Makes 26 lbs of Ice per 24 hours - Ice Cubes ready in 8 Minutes - Electric Ice Making Machine with Ice Scoop and 1.5 lb Ice Storage - Silver
feature_bullets: PORTABLE ICE POWER - This powerful ice maker creates delicious, chewable, bullet shaped ice up to 1. 5 lbs. at a time and up to 26 lbs. of ice per day with its 2. 2-liter water reservoir. Measures just 9. 5 x 12. 9 x 14" - an ideal choice for ice anytime, anywhere

ICE CUBES DONE QUICK - Features small or medium size options for bullet shape ice, ready in just 6 to 8 minutes. The small ice cube bullets are smooth and cylinder-shaped to easily fit in water bottle openings, and the medium size is perfect for mixed drinks and more

ENERGY EFFICIENT ICE MAKER - Equipped with a compressor that requires low energy to cool, this ice machine is a tiny yet mighty addition to your bar or countertop (NOTE: Use ice shortly after making or store ice batches in freezer if not using right away)

SMART DESIGN - A water reservoir sits below the ice basket and reuses water from the melted ice to make even more ice. Warning lights and an automatic shut off function are activated once the ice basket is full or when water needs to be refilled

INCLUDES BASKET and ICE SCOOP - No installation required; just fill the water reservoir, plug it in and wait for the ice to form. This ETL Certified electric ice maker has an easy to use control panel and comes with a removable ice basket and scoop

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,980 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
